meanings.definition: A naturally occurring mineral with a porous structure used as a catalyst or adsorbent.
meanings.sent1: The zeolite in the soil helps to filter out impurities.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study zeolite to understand its unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The zeolite at the bottom of the lake decided to take up a new hobby - cleaning water!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a zeolite, absorbing knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The zeolite acted like a sponge, soaking up all the excess chemicals.

meanings.definition: A synthetic material with similar properties used in water purification and other applications.
meanings.sent1: The company developed a new zeolite for cleaning up oil spills.
meanings.sent2: Zeolite is commonly used in household water filters.
meanings.sent3: The zeolite in the lab liked to pretend it was a superhero saving the day.
meanings.sent4: His words were like zeolite, absorbing all the negativity around him.
meanings.sent5: The zeolite powder worked like magic, purifying the contaminated water.
